intro: Alsine rostrata var. brevifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. This plant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and drought tolerance. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
